page.title: 07ECOLOGY,RAINFALL
page.content: There are 4 rain gauges installed in or near the area.Some of these only operated for a few years after 1964 during the period when the use of this valley as a potential reservoir site was being investigated. LLWYN LLYDAN, further up the Senni valley,at 351 metres,appears to have a total annual rainfall of about 2280 mm.GARN WEN, at 256 metres is somewhat drier at 1962 mm. At FOREST LODGE, at 350 metres, below the steep slope of Fan Frynych,the annual total is about 1880 mm. The rainfall falls off rapidly towards the north so that BAILEA, in the northern part of this area, the total is only 1483 mm. All of these sites show that the westtest month is usual- ly November or December; the driest month is either May or June.
